alert.note: Alert for Dorchester; Jasper (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 10:23AM EST until further notice by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort, Berkeley, Charleston, Colleton, Dorchester and Jasper. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1021 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated widespread moderate to locally heavy rainfall expanding over much of Southeast South Carolina as strong nor`easter approaches. The risk for flooding will steadily increase this morning as high tide approaches. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Summerville, Hilton Head Island, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Bluffton, Beaufort, Port Royal, Moncks Corner, Walterboro, Tybee Island, Edisto Beach, Givhans Ferry State Park, West Ashley, Ladson, Naval Weapons Station Charleston, Bellinger Hill Area, Dorchester and Clarendon.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
